text: they smashed jewelry Tennessee police
officers say they interrupted a burglary
in progress the Franklin Police
Department was called to a shopping mall
south of Nashville around 8 pm on
December 3rd doors were open and
customers inside as officers ran in
they smashed jewelry
body cam video shows cops arrived in
time to witness people with what appears
to be a sledgehammer breaking the tops
of glass jewelry displays authorities
say one suspect pepper sprayed an
employee during the incident going out
in the main mall down the ground the
suspects were pursued into the mall
where another suspect got into an
alleged physical altercation with an
officer oh my God
oh my God
four suspects were arrested in
connection with this incident according
to Franklin Police there have been at
least five similar incidents across
Tennessee and Arkansas over the past
several weeks with a combined loss of
more than 1.5 million dollars this is
Inside Edition digital
